Title: Traffic Engineer - Senior/Transportation Planner
Job Description:
Traffic Engineer - Senior/Transportation Planner

Manage projects that require technical analysis utilizing transportation and traffic operations and simulation software. Manage staff that provides project support on a variety of traffic, transit and parking studies. Manage city transportation master plan projects.
BS in Civil Engineering, MS preferred. At least 7 years professional experience: project management experience (i.e., junior project manager). Extensive experience with Synchro, HCS, Passer or other intersection operations software; knowledge of simulation software (Corsim, Vissim) desirable, but not necessary; familiarity with traffic, transit and parking analyses; travel demand models such as MINUTP and TP+; good writing/communication/client-relations skills. PE required.

Title: Transportation Engineer II
Job Description:
POSITION: Transportation Engineer II
POSITION SUMMARY:
Experienced professionals and recent graduates alike encounter more than just a job at Baxter & Woodman – they discover a lasting, rewarding career with a recognized leader in technology and innovation. Baxter & Woodman offers an exceptional work environment. Named a 2022 Zweig Best Firms To Work For means we appreciate and value our staff, providing them with a comprehensive benefits package that includes flexible work schedules, an outstanding 401K match, and more.
Baxter & Woodman has a rewarding opportunity for a transportation engineer starting immediately, in our Chicago, Crystal Lake, Naperville or Mokena Illinois office. This position will primarily consist of design engineering efforts on a variety of transportation projects for State, County, and Local Agencies. A knowledge of designing roadway, drainage and underground improvements with Geopak is preferred. This team orientated position will include working with Baxter & Woodman’s diverse disciplines and offices.
POSITION DUTIES:
Design Roadway, Drainage, Underground Utility, and Infrastructure improvements using Geopak
Conduct drainage, traffic, and various engineering studies
Complete general civil engineering services for municipal, county and state clients
Complete engineering plans and specifications using IDOT Standards
Process Federal Aid Phase I and II projects for a variety of clients
Assist with construction engineering services for municipal, county and state clients
Assist project engineers and managers by making significant decisions on a wide variety of tasks required during project delivery
REQUIREMENTS:
B.S. degree in Civil Engineering with at least 2 years of relevant job experience working on municipal or highway agency transportation projects
Ability to travel throughout Baxter & Woodman’s service area (own transportation)
Ability to independently handle a variety of ongoing tasks and responsibilities
Strong written, verbal, computer and organizational skills
E.I.T (Engineer in Training) required
P.E. license desired
Work within a team-first culture that encourages individual development and accomplishment of goals

Title: Transportation Engineer Specialist
Job Description:

23-01901
Transportation Engineer Specialist
Pay Grade
17
Salary
$5,178.72 - $6,254.30 Monthly
Employment Type
EXECUTIVE BRANCH | FULL TIME INELIGIBLE FOR OVERTIME PAY | 18A | 37.5 HR/WK
Hiring Agency
Transportation Cabinet | Department of Highways
Location
200 Mero St
Frankfort KY 40622 USA

The agency may authorize the selected candidate to telecommute. The agency may terminate or modify the telecommuting arrangement at any time.
Description
The Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is committed to meeting or exceeding the needs and expectations of our customers. Our focus is on people: our customers, our employees, and our partners. We will continually improve both the delivery of our products and services and the processes that support that delivery. To provide a safe, efficient, environmentally sound, and fiscally responsible transportation system that delivers economic opportunity and enhances the quality of life in Kentucky.

By joining our Division of Highway Design, Roadway Design Branch as a Transportation Engineering Specialist in Franklin County, you’ll have the opportunity to provide oversight on transportation projects in the project development phase and serve as a liaison to the Districts’ Project Development staff helping to effectively and efficiently deliver the Highway Plan.

Holders of the Transportation Engineering Specialist position will complete tasks such as:
Provides technical expertise, support budget and scope oversight, and liaison (Central Office to/from Districts) for project teams through all stages of design in order to get projects to a timely letting.
Interprets, writes & recommends reports, correspondence and technical papers for design compliance with Department and Federal Highways Administration (FHWA) policies, standards and procedures.
Attends major project reviews and/or meetings, including site visits. May include public meetings and/or hearings.
Coordinates with agencies such as FHWA, other state agencies, and other Department divisions to facilitate design activities throughout the project development process.
Desired candidates possess the following requisite skills or experience applicable to the position:
Project Management Experience
Highway Design Experience
Communication Skills
Additional position information (travel required, standing/stooping/bending/lifting, sitting at a desk, etc.)
May require some travel.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

The Kentucky Transportation Cabinet (KYTC) participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in U.S. KYTC will only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E-Verify, or if you believe that KYTC has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) at 888-897-7781 or https://www.e-verify.gov/.

If you are looking for a rewarding career with a culture of employee involvement, where teamwork is the norm and measurement of performance is essential, the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet is for you!

We look forward to reviewing your application.
Minimum Requirements
EDUCATION: See Special Requirements.

EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, OR SKILLS: Must have four years of engineering experience in addition to that required for licensure.

Substitute EDUCATION for EXPERIENCE: A master's degree in engineering will substitute for one year of the required experience. Graduate work in engineering beyond a master's degree will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.

Substitute EXPERIENCE for EDUCATION: NONE

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS (AGE, LICENSURE, REGULATION, ETC.): Must possess a valid driver's license prior to appointment in this classification. Must be licensed as a professional engineer by the Kentucky State Board of Licensure for Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors OR must be licensed in another state with the ability to obtain a Professional Engineering license from the Kentucky State Board of Licensure for Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors within the employee's initial six month probationary period. Engineering decisions recommended by individuals without a Kentucky Professional Engineering License must be approved by a KY LPE under KRS 322 until licensure is obtained. For additional information refer to: http://kyboels.ky.gov/ Must maintain any required licensure(s), certification(s), or other credentials for the length of employment in this classification. Employing agency is responsible for ensuring employee possesses and maintains required licensure(s), certification(s) or other credentials.
Working Conditions
Work is performed in the office and in the field. Will be exposed to risks inherent to construction sites.
Probationary Period
This job has an initial and promotional probationary period of 6 months, except as provided in KRS 18A.111.
If you have questions about this advertisement, please contact Patrick Perry at Patrick.Perry@ky.gov or 502-319-3758.
